file_content.text: Don't worry about us. We'll run when the time comes.
I've helped you all I can. Rest is up to you.
Disable those turrets, reprogram the droids and burn yourself a security passcode. You'll breeze right into the Hutt Embassy--guaranteed.
Chief Hurkwill? Shalim Avesta sent us. He says you know a way into the Hutt Embassy.
If I'd known a Jedi war hero was coming, I'd have cleaned myself up and made some lunch.
A real live Jedi Master--now we're talking! Pardon the stink. Haven't been near a shower in days.
It's an honor, Major. Forgive the smell, but I haven't seen a working shower since before the takeover.
You're one of the Republic's big shots, eh? Forgive the stench. Showers are scarce out here.
Apologies for the stench. Ever since we left the city, showers have been scarce.
Hutt embassy's locked up tight. Used to have a fancy-pants bureaucrat helping us inside--Representative Ecklin--but he's gone quiet. Probably dead.
Good news is, the Cartel hasn't changed anything at their embassy. Got the same turrets, droids, passcodes I set up for them. Lazy Hutts.
Getting in should be easy.
When this is all over, we'll have to thank the Hutts for making our job simple.
They may be stupid, but they're still pretty good at killing folks.
Storming enemy territory is much simpler with a well-informed guide.
"Simple" is a stretch. Let's go with "not instantly lethal."
If your intel's good, this will be a walk in the park.
"Walk" might be generous, but your survival odds just went up to fifty-fifty.
The secret to any good break-in is having an inside man.
Never figured I'd be on the wrong side of my own defenses. Wish I'd made them less deadly.
Why does the Hutt Cartel have an embassy on Makeb--much less one that well-guarded?
Why is there an embassy?
The Business Council built it when the Hutts first came to do business here. Thought it would make the slugs feel appreciated.
How do you know they haven't set up new procedures and kept them secret?
That seems unlikely.
The other great thing about Hutts? They're overconfident. Never expected to be facing the likes of you, either.
You want inside the Hutt Embassy, you'll have to finesse three layers of security. First layer is heavy turrets in the courtyard.
The only good thing to come out of these groundquakes is that they exposed the turret power generators. Overload those, and turrets lose their punch.
Disable the turret power generators so we don't get torched on the way in. And then?
Understood.
I doubt the Hutts left those generators unguarded. How hard will it be to reach them?
They'll try to stop us.
City's under curfew. Streets are crawling with Hutt-loyal Regulators.
Our mission would be a lot simpler if we could take down the entire power grid.
Can we black out the city?
Even if I knew how to cause a blackout, the city's computers need energy--and you need computers.
Security layer two is the embassy's main door. Three meters of reinforced durasteel. Even a lightsaber would take hours to cut through.
But the door will unlock for a diplomatic passcode. You can generate one by accessing the government building's secure terminal.
Get inside the government building, slice the secure terminal for a passcode and get out. Next?
Seems easy enough.
There have to be Regulators on the street carrying passcodes. We'll be fighting them anyway, right?
Can't we just steal one?
Only top officers get into the embassy. You won't find them patrolling the streets.
I remember when all you needed to bust open a building was detonite and attitude.
This is so complicated.
The good ol' days. I miss them, too.
Last but not least are the security droids. Top-of-the-line Arkanian models. Nasty disposition. Shoot intruders on sight.
Good news is they can be reprogrammed. The droid control station in my old security HQ will do the trick.
Sounds like a plan.
We could use some allies. Those droids will do nicely. We'll take it from here, chief.
Turning the droids against the Hutts will be poetic justice. You've been most helpful, chief--we're going in.
We'll get the droids working for us. Smart thinking, chief. We're on our way.
I've always wanted my own droid army. Thanks for the tip, old-timer. Let's do this.
After jumping through those first two hoops, I'll prefer to crush a droid army the old-fashioned way.
I'd rather destroy the droids.
Not saying you couldn't, but probably not before everyone in the embassy got hustled to evac shuttles--and the databanks with them.
Sounds like you just volunteered for the job. Have fun.
Why don't you go do that?
Every Regulator in the city knows my face. Wouldn't get ten meters. You'll make it at least twice that far.
Hit those objectives, and I guarantee you'll get inside the embassy. Whether you'll find your answers is a different matter.
If Representative Ecklin's still alive, maybe help him escape? He's a fussbudget, but basically alright. I'll keep a comm channel open when I can.
Think twice before you visit the city. Hutt curfew means unauthorized types get shot on sight.
The Hutt Embassy's all yours. Mind your step in there.
You won't have to worry about those turrets.
That should take care of the security droids.
That passcode will open the embassy's main doors.
We're already analyzing the Project Failsafe plans Representative Ecklin transmitted to us. They're sickening.
Toborro the Hutt is masterminding the greatest crime in galactic history. With Veedrig's ark, they'll escape Makeb and leave us all to die. We can't let that happen.
The Devaronian is more salesman than soldier. If we pressure him, he'll turn against the Hutts and give us the ark.
Veedrig might help us.
No doubt Veedrig's sticking close to his project until he's paid.
The Devaronian promises much. We need to know if this ark can accomplish everything he guarantees.
Time for a chat with Veedrig.
Every other word in his plans is misspelled, and I'm no expert on engineering jargon, but the basics appear sound.
If we want to stop the Hutts from leaving in their fancy ark, Veedrig's the man to see.
Veedrig is the key.
Calling the ark schematics "fuzzy" would be a compliment. We need the source of this data.
I know this Devaronian's type. A thousand credits says he'll switch sides if we point a blaster in his face.
Veedrig will join us, or else.
I don't condone threats of violence, but in this case... threaten away.
The only way that ark's leaving is with us at the helm and Makeb's people safe inside it.
Let's hijack that ark.
If there's any justice in the galaxy, we'll get to see the look on Toborro's face as we depart in his starship.
We can't take the ark for ourselves until we hunt down its construction site. Found any clues yet?
We need a place to start.
Lemda was just reviewing that data.
I matched the ark construction site's map to topographic readings. The ark's being built at a secret facility inside the Giant's Spear.
That's a big tourist trap--a mesa with a hollow interior. Too dangerous to colonize, but perfect for hiding an ark's construction.
All we need now is a plan.
If the ark is the Hutts' only escape, they'll have it locked down tight. What security measures will we face?
An unplanned assault could result in irreparable damage to the ark. What's the safest way to secure the ship?
Not sure yet, Master Jedi, but we have probe droids gathering intel right now.
Commandeering a ship that size won't be easy. What objectives do we hit to secure the ark?
Can't say yet, Major. We're sending probe droids to survey the area.
Stealing ships is easy. Getting to them is the tough part. Any clue how many guards they have?
No idea, Captain, but our probe droids are scanning the whole mesa.
With all these groundquakes, we'll be lucky if that place doesn't collapse and take the ark with it.
I wouldn't say "perfect."
All the more reason to move quickly.
There's no way the Hutts could've started a major construction project inside a planetary landmark without attracting attention.
No one noticed this?
We closed all access to the Giant's Spear out of safety concerns months ago--at Toborro's urging. He duped us.
Contact me when you're at the Giant's Spear. I'll help you plan this attack. It won't be an easy fight.
You're alive--guess my advice worked, huh? Shalim told me to patch you through right away.
Don't look at me. I've got a city to evacuate. Good luck.
